subject: Productivity
title: Opportunity Cost
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Opportunity Cost.

hook.text: Every yes is a hidden no. Every hour spent on one task is an hour stolen from another.

buildup.text: Economists call this opportunity cost: the value of the best alternative you gave up by choosing something.

discovery.text: Most people track what they spend but never track what they sacrifice. The invisible cost is often larger.

twist.text: Saying yes to a mediocre meeting means saying no to deep work. The meeting's true cost is what you didn't create.

climax.text: Strategic thinkers don't just evaluate options. They evaluate what each option costs them in lost alternatives.

punchline.text: The cost of saying yes is everything you can't do instead.

quiz.question: What is opportunity cost?
options: The value of the best alternative you gave up
The financial cost of a decision
The time spent making a decision
